 Experience Internship Google Summer of Code (GSoC 2015) May 2015  – Present (4 months) Amsterdam Area, Netherlands The goal of the ongoing Google Summer of Code project is to develop and implement (in Python) autoepistemic reasoning for Probabilistic Logic Network (PLN) framework within OpenCog, which is an open source cognitive platform.  
 PhD Candidate, Mathematics University of Amsterdam September 2011  –  May 2015  (3 years 9 months) Amsterdam Area, Netherlands In my PhD research, I have developed algorithmic techniques for correspondence theory in logics, based on their algebraic analysis. For a complete list of publications and talks, see http://staff.fnwi.uva.nl/s.sourabh. 
 
Logic is the study of principles of reasoning. It is an interdisciplinary field with applications in Mathematics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Linguistics and Philosophy. Correspondence theory, which is the topic of my PhD project, aims at answering how formal languages in logic interact and overlap in their shared semantic environment. A major part of my project has been dedicated to designing algorithms to compare modal logic with first-order logic, using algebraic techniques. Correspondence theory has applications in both Database theory for query answering and automated theorem proving. During my PhD I have published research articles in peer-reviewed journals, given presentations in international conferences, and also have been involved in teaching master courses.  Internship Bravo Lucy As April 2011  –  May 2011  (2 months) Hyderabad Area, India As a part of supply chain analytics team, I developed models for predicting optimal 
orders for new product introduction using statistical and machine learning techniques, 
followed by their implementation in R. Research Assistant Max Planck Institute for Informatics May 2010  –  July 2010  (3 months) Saarbrücken Area, Germany I contributed to the SPASS project. SPASS is an automated theorem prover for first-order logic with equality. I worked on developing and implementing an algorithm for formula renaming in clause normal form. A report is available at https://staff.fnwi.uva.nl/s.sourabh/alg.pdf. Research Assistant Indian Statistical Instiute, Kolkata June 2007  –  July 2007  (2 months) Kolkata Area, India This research project was a comparative study and implementation of the various algorithms for (k, n) Visual Threshold Scheme and general access structures using MATLAB. We proposed a novel strategy to reduce the pixel expansion and fine tune the image obtained after obtaining the result. Experience Software Developer MasterCard Payment Gateway Services May 2015  – Present (4 months) Edinburgh, United Kingdom Java and Perl backend developer at MasterCard Payment Gateway Services. Junior Firmware Developer at Fon. Fon January 2014  –  December 2014  (1 year) Madrid My team was in charge to develop a fork of OpenWrt and others support applications for Fon wireless equipment. 
 
During the time that I worked at Fon, I developed: daemons, init scripts, kernel modules and other low level applications in C. 
 
I got a strong knowledge of 802.11 standard. In the time that I worked on Fon I had to patch related Linux daemons and libraries and also develop daemons that works with this standard. A good example of this was a patch that I developed for WPASuplicant. 
 
Besides I developed a back-port of Veth module for the Linux kernel 2.21 based on Tuntap module. 
 
Furthermore I developed the configuration panel of the Gramofon. In order to accomplish that, I had to code the frontend with Html and Javascript code, and also implement several ubus calls in different daemons. 
 
In addition, I worked with Java, C++ and MongoDB on the backend, developing applications to control the wireless equipment remotely. A good reference is the client/server implementation of TR-69 that we developed. 
 
Finally I got experience with Agile/Scrum, Jira and Git because this was the common way to work with the rest of my team members. Freelancer Android developer as freelancer. Strong skills: C++, C#, Java, Unity3d, web development.

Summary I have what it takes to solve complex problems and meet deadlines, backed by a steady experience of Google Summer of Code 2014 and two Internships at IIT-Bombay. I have contributed to open source project - The Wiselib, as a part internship with Google Summer of Code. 
 
In my career so far I have worn many hats - programmer, web designer, app developer, researcher, team leader/player and strategist. As a result, I have a unique ability to handle multi-disciplinary projects and to navigate complex challenges. So far my experience has taught me that my professional values boil down to: 
 
- I have been an avid developer and I have loved being one. 
 
- I am a multi-linguist of technology-driven work. I speak fluent geek, developer, team leader, trainer, and a constructive-critic. 
 
- I have Big Ideas, and the gut to pursue those ideas. 
 
- I am self-motivated and passionate about technology.  
 
- I have always kept myself abreast of latest technology, I BREATHE TECHNOLOGY. 
 
- I live by the mantra of making life simple by utilizing technology to an extent only the makers can imagine, this quality gives me an edge over others. 
 
I love making new professional acquaintances. Reach out if you would like to discuss technology, business or anything "challenging" under the sun at dhruv.joshi@outlook.com. Summary Currently pursuing a Masters in Informatics at University of California, Irvine. 
I have a vast set of interests ranging from mobile applications to large scale systems with a focus of development and test.  
4 years of experience as a Software Engineer and a subsequent Masters in Information and Computer Science has helped me get into a unique position where I appreciate the end-2-end development of features of a system, understand how users are affected by those and take care of the underlying design and complexities all at the same time.  
 
Areas of Interest: Ubiquitous Computing, Human Computer Interaction, Rich Internet Applications, Design Patterns, Data Structures
